Tasman Fracture Marine Park


1 min



Dahlia Foo


Sep 22, 2023








No matching items






Animal Behaviour


Investigating the hunting, mating, and social behaviours of marine predators to understand their roles in marine ecosystems.




Anthropogenic Interactions


Examining the impact of human activities such as fishing, plastic pollution, and invasive species on marine predators and their habitats.




Art-Science Collaborations


Fusing art and science to increase public engagement and awareness about marine predators and their conservation needs.




Antarctic and the Southern Ocean


Focused research on marine predators in the Antarctic region, studying their adaptations to extreme conditions and roles in the Southern Ocean ecosystem.




Bio-logging


Utilising technology to track marine predators’ movements, diving patterns, and other behaviours to gather insights on their natural habitats.




Temperate Marine Predators


Research on predators in temperate zones, exploring their ecology, behaviours, and interactions within these specific marine environments.
